query: Seven Brief Lessons on Physics was written by an Italian physicist that has worked in France since what year?
summary:
Executive Summary:

Carlo Rovelli is an Italian theoretical physicist born on 3 May 1956, in Verona, Italy. He has worked in various prominent institutions, including Aix-Marseille University in France. As per the provided information, Carlo Rovelli has worked in France since at least 1984 when he started working at the Centre de Physique Th√©orique of Marseille.
